intro: Camaridium minus, commonly known as the lesser camaridium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Camaridium minus thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
